data.title: great coffee from a non-franchise beanery
data.text:
The owner operator and staff are friendly and helpful.  There is good selection of brews served up quickly and hot.  Whole bean offerings will be ground to your request or packaged for home brewing as you wish.
Rich flavors and abundant.
They have a nice selection of mugs and merchandise to give to the coffee lover in your crowd.  Well located on the pedestrian mall near banks, government offices and downtown hotels.

data.title: Excellent Cappucino; Caramel Royale very sweet
data.text: Our first time at the West Coast Coffee shop.  We visited during Art Prize event in Grand Rapids.  The cappucino I had was very good, not bitter.  My partner had the Caramel Royale.  She liked it a lot, but it was too sweet for me.  (i generally do not like sweets.)  Price was very reasonable for a handcrafted beverage. The place itself was nice for a coffee house, plenty of seating during regular days; however, being that it was Art Prize time in Grand Rapids, the place was very busy.  The barista kept things moving, and we did not have to wait long for our drinks.
